summary: This document is a detailed internal timeline report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, chronicling the events leading up to, during, and immediately following the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. It details his activities, the discovery of his body, medical response, notifications to authorities and family, and the subsequent investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death by apparent suicide is the central subject of the timeline. He was visited by attorneys on August 9 and found unresponsive in his cell on August 10.

persons.name: Reyes Efrain
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate at MCC New York, who departed for court on the morning of August 9, 2019, before Epstein was found.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The judge overseeing Epstein's case, who was notified of his death at 10:00 am on August 10.

persons.name: Dr. Robert Negle
persons.context: Arrived at the institution on August 13, 2019, as part of the post-incident review.

persons.name: Dr. Kristin Willert
persons.context: Arrived at the institution with Dr. Negle on August 13, 2019, for the post-incident review.

connections.description: Were cellmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.
Judge Berman was the presiding judge in Epstein's case and was officially notified of his death.

events.title: Epstein's Last Full Day
events.description: Epstein's cellmate departs for court. Epstein spends the day in attorney conferences and is reported to be in 'good spirits' during a social call in the evening.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein Unresponsive
events.description: At 6:33 am, a body alarm is activated. Staff find Epstein unresponsive in his cell. CPR is initiated and medical emergency procedures are followed.

events.title: Medical Response and Transport
events.description: Medical staff and EMS continue CPR, intubate Epstein, administer epinephrine, and transport him to Beekman Hospital. He is pronounced dead at 7:36 am.

events.title: Official Notifications Begin
events.description: A cascade of notifications is made: USMS, PIO, FBI, AUSA, Judge Berman, and Epstein's next of kin (his brother). The institution is placed on modified operations.

events.title: Investigation Initiated
events.description: FBI and OIG agents arrive at the institution. The body is released to the Medical Examiner. Computer hard drives from the SHU are removed for investigation.

events.title: Post-Incident Review Team Arrives
events.description: Dr. Robert Negle (National Suicide Prevention Coordinator) and Dr. Kristin Willert (National Sex Offender Program Coordinator) arrive at MCC New York.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the MCC New York SHU at approximately 6:33 am on Saturday, August 10, 2019.
Epstein had been visited by several attorneys throughout the day on Friday, August 9, and was reported to be in 'good spirits' during a social call at 7:00 pm that evening.
His cellmate, Reyes Efrain, had departed for court earlier on August 9, meaning Epstein was alone in the cell when he was found.
The timeline shows rapid notification of numerous agencies including the FBI, USMS, OIG, and the presiding judge, Judge Berman, within hours of the incident.
Computer hard drives from the SHU were removed and replaced on the night of August 10, indicating a focus on securing potential electronic evidence.
